title: Bankruptcy?
question: I have a 100000 dollar payment due on my mortgage when my mortgage is done. Can I file bankruptcy now to get that payment removed from my mortgage
answers:
It is somewhat unclear, but you seem to be describing a balloon payment that comes due on your mortgage in the amount of $100,000.

While you can discharge her personal liability arising from the original promissory note, the lien of the lender against your home is not subject to discharge.

If the mortgage is a junior lien, i.e., in a second or third position behind a first mortgage, it may be possible to "strip" the lien if the home is worth less than the amount owing on the first mortgage. This could only be done in a Chapter 13 case where you would have to make payments into a plan of reorganization for 36 to 60 months.

If the mortgage is the senior lien, it cannot be discharged as a lien upon the property.
